alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 12:44PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Showers with strong winds will impact portions of northwestern Atlantic, central Cumberland, Salem, Camden and Gloucester Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1243 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from Folcroft to near Port Penn. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. This line of showers has a history of producing wind gusts up to 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camden, Vineland, Millville, Bridgeton, Gloucester City, Chester, Deptford, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Pennsville, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Carneys Point, Berlin, Paulsboro and Salem. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 3. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 676 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 29 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
